intro: Descurainia brevifructa, commonly known as the short-fruited tansy, is an annual flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, and its leaves are typically pinnately lobed. It thrives in disturbed soils and can often be found in fields and along roadsides. The plant is also known for its distinctive, somewhat pungent odor.
